tasks.title: Build triage script to identify bad titles
tasks.description: Create Python script that scans _artworks/*.md and identifies titles that are filenames, timestamps, or nonsense
tasks.approach: Scan all artwork files, match against bad title patterns (file extensions, camera prefixes, timestamps, URL encoding, wix artifacts), output tracking JSON
acceptance_criteria: Preserves existing completed status on re-run

subtasks.title: Implement bad title pattern detection
subtasks.description: Create regex patterns and logic to identify bad titles

subtasks.title: Generate tracking JSON with statistics
subtasks.description: Output title_review_status.json with per-artwork status and aggregate stats

subtasks.title: Support incremental updates
subtasks.description: Re-running triage should preserve completed items and detect new artworks

notes.text: Pure pattern matching - no AI needed. Just regex/string checks for bad title patterns.

tasks.title: Build review web application
tasks.description: Create Flask app for reviewing AI-suggested titles with approve/skip/back workflow
tasks.approach: Flask app that reads artworks with suggested_title field, displays image and titles, allows editing and approval, updates frontmatter on approve
acceptance_criteria: Shows current title and suggested title
Progress indicator shows X of Y

subtasks.title: Create Flask app skeleton with routes
subtasks.description: Set up Flask app with routes for /, /review/<filename>, /approve, /skip, /status, /complete

subtasks.title: Create review interface template
subtasks.description: HTML template showing image, current title, editable suggested title, and action buttons

subtasks.title: Implement approve functionality
subtasks.description: On approve: update title in frontmatter, remove suggested_title, update tracking file
acceptance_criteria: Updates title field in artwork markdown
Updates status to completed in tracking file

subtasks.title: Add basic styling
subtasks.description: CSS for clean, functional review interface

notes.text: Use uv run for all scripts - no global installs. Dependencies: pyyaml, flask.

tasks.title: Test end-to-end workflow
tasks.description: Verify the complete pipeline works: triage identifies bad titles, review app displays and saves correctly
tasks.approach: Run triage to generate tracking file, manually add suggested_title to one artwork, test review app approval flow, verify markdown is updated

tasks.title: Generate title suggestions (incremental)
tasks.description: Claude Code views artwork images and adds suggested_title to frontmatter, 5-10 artworks per session
tasks.approach: Read tracking file to find needs_review artworks, read each image, generate descriptive title following style guidelines, add suggested_title to frontmatter, update tracking file
acceptance_criteria: Tracking file updated to has_suggestion status

notes.text: Conversational batch control: user says 'do 5 more' or 'suggest titles for next 10'. Progress tracked in title_review_status.json so sessions can resume.
Added suggested titles to first batch of 5 artworks: Cal Band details (3), still life, and life drawing.

tasks.title: Complete review cycle
tasks.description: Review all AI-suggested titles via web app and verify all bad titles have been replaced
tasks.approach: Use review web app to approve/edit all suggested titles, run triage to verify no bad titles remain
acceptance_criteria: All ~160 bad titles have been reviewed
Zero artworks remain with filename-style titles
All titles are descriptive and properly formatted
